data.text:
Health care systems across the globe have joined the #RaceToZero carbon emissions in a first-of-its-kind commitment to ambitious #ClimateAction from a sector on the frontlines of the #COVID19 crisis.

More from @UNFCCC: https://t.co/MDVkPuWc8m https://t.co/noinFpnwtC

"It is a tragic irony that this time of relative calm, compared with earlier years of the conflict, is also a period of immense & growing humanitarian suffering of the Syrian people."

-- @UNEnvoySyria briefs Security Council on situation in the country. https://t.co/U6qrkQPJSe

"We have the laws & the tools to protect civilians from harm in armed conflicts. It is time that all States & parties to conflicts, apply them.”

-- @UNReliefChief to Security Council. https://t.co/5GqpdFliOH

Although #COVID19 affected people's lives everywhere, women have been particularly impacted by the pandemic. 

@UN_Women has 4 lessons learned from the crisis that must be taken into consideration as we seek to recover better. https://t.co/wRqA2hqOXp https://t.co/mvP18COdIE

More & more countries are committing to cut greenhouse gas emissions in order to limit global temperature rise and tackle the climate crisis.  

Find out where your country stands in the #RaceToZero emissions:
https://t.co/fhnoPpHx24 #ClimateAction https://t.co/W7ruszIlQd

As #COVID19 has impacted people around the 🌍, UN teams are working to save lives & livelihoods. Since March 2020, they have helped deliver:

🏥 Essential health services to 240M people 
🚰 Water & sanitation to 36M people
💉 60M+ vaccines 

https://t.co/KNfWTj95lU https://t.co/tjcfW2i87b

Warm wishes to all those celebrating Vesak!
Learn more as people around the world celebrate the Day of the Full Moon: https://t.co/7xyParl9We

📸: 2018's #Vesak celebration at UNHQ in NYC. https://t.co/hBqUYbSezX

"We need greater investment in a low-carbon future"

-- @antonioguterres calls for an end to coal use and a shift of subsidies from fossil fuel to renewable energy. https://t.co/2VUq0TTCo4 #ClimateAction https://t.co/4E3VYN9Io6

Since the creation of the UN in 1945, 80+ former colonies have gained independence. 

The International Week of Solidarity with Peoples of Non-Self-Governing Territories starts on Tuesday: https://t.co/nomsytWFJi https://t.co/bmERkYXN3Z

“#COVID19 has exposed deep-seated inequalities & endangered hard-won development gains throughout Africa & beyond."

-- On Tuesday's #AfricaDay, @antonioguterres reiterates his call for developed nations to stand in solidarity with Africa. https://t.co/9pzpFzb6oK

Racism & intolerance are problems prevalent in all societies.

But each of us can #StandUp4HumanRights and #FightRacism, discrimination & hatred.

Here's how YOU can take action: https://t.co/Ijz1XWpOD8 https://t.co/KV9SSOPU9X

Yemen: @WFP is increasing food assistance for the worst hunger hotspots in the country in an effort to prevent a devastating famine.

But more support is needed to help the nearly 50,000 people already living in famine-like conditions. https://t.co/9gdborsKIZ

Tuesday is #AfricaDay! 

Check out @africarenewal for latest information & analysis of major economic and development challenges facing Africa today: https://t.co/2cxagBgu9U https://t.co/xhp65DgE8I

“One peacekeeper lost continues to be one too many.”

@UNPeacekeeping chief @Lacroix_UN tells Security Council that since the beginning of this year alone, 15 peacekeepers lost their lives due to malicious acts. https://t.co/rEchZYL7AK

.@antonioguterres deeply concerned over apparent forced landing of plane over Belarus & detention of journalist Roman Protasevich.

He remains greatly concerned by deteriorating human rights situation in aftermath of last August's presidential elections. https://t.co/S0WmNWFMwG

I pay tribute to the frontline health workers who are the heroes of this #COVID19 pandemic. Millions of healthcare professionals continue to put themselves in harm’s way every day. We owe them our deepest appreciation.

-- @antonioguterres. https://t.co/ItJeiXYwxJ #WHA74

"Placing women & girls at the centre of our efforts & concerns will help us better protect civilians & build a more sustainable peace."

Meet Major Steplyne Nyaboga of Kenya, winner of the UN Military Gender Advocate of the Year Award.   https://t.co/5YU2FoVG9r

Civilians caught up in conflict are killed & injured in greater numbers than members of fighting forces. 

They often face additional threats, including sexual violence, mass displacement & acute hunger. 

They are #NotATarget!

More from @UNOCHA: https://t.co/p5I1blkzJ2

Amid the pandemic, it is completely normal to feel anxious, isolated or overwhelmed, but we are in this together -- and #OnlyTogether will we get through it.

May is #MentalHealthMonth.

🎨: @UN_Women https://t.co/8Zd6ZUl9dY

Working 55+ hours per week increases people's health risks, including: 

🧠 35% higher risk of a stroke
💟 17% higher risk of dying from heart disease

@WHO has more on the rising number of deaths linked to long working hours: https://t.co/7U5nuTeXgX https://t.co/2gL315r4f0

Each year, more than 8 million tonnes of plastic end up in the ocean.

Be a #ClimateAction Superhero and help protect our water resources by avoiding single-use plastics, taking shorter showers and turning off the tap when brushing your teeth. https://t.co/nAjeCApKJ4 #ActNow https://t.co/4YCJQb18Kz

The world has made great progress in expanding protected and conserved areas since 2010. 

But 1/3 of Key Biodiversity Areas still lack any protection.

More from @UNEP: 
https://t.co/RJFrSDDm0h https://t.co/OwWg81rrQt

Attacks on journalists are attacks on freedom of expression. 

Now, more than ever, we need facts and press freedom. 

Defending journalism is standing up for democracy. https://t.co/ZtVYc0BvGn via @UNESCO https://t.co/IWs5utwC9S

What does it take to work for the UN in some of the world’s most difficult and dangerous situations?

In Season 3 of our podcast 'Awake At Night', @MelissaFleming speaks with extraordinary UN staff members to find out!

🔊 Listen to their powerful testimonies. https://t.co/GYIcZRW6Q5

Are you a young journalist looking to cover this year’s #UNGA & more? 

You may be eligible for a @unraf fellowship. This year’s programme will be conducted entirely online. Find out more: https://t.co/pY2qocuwFb. https://t.co/kTW0NwYse4

Rural areas could face: 

🚱 30% water deficit by 2030
🥀 95% of land areas degraded by 2050

Greater efforts must be taken to develop rural areas without causing irreparable damage to the environment. 

More in @UNDESA's latest #WorldSocialReport: https://t.co/n4hIJ7cTvM https://t.co/jD7QNwEIFV

We can get to net zero greenhouse gas emissions to limit global temperature rise & tackle the climate crisis if we take urgent #ClimateAction now. 

In every part of the world, cities, businesses, investors & educators are rallying behind the #RaceToZero. https://t.co/MSAJURvuZg https://t.co/ED9uZKDuCr

No woman should suffer needlessly from a preventable condition like fistula.

On Sunday's #EndFistula Day, see how @UNFPA is helping women overcome this devastating childbirth injury: https://t.co/9mzgQrQZSI https://t.co/bzQc91WBpu

Hear from @WHO's Dr. Rderico Ofrin as he explains why #COVID19 cases in India have risen so fast, and what must be done to stop the spread. 

#OnlyTogether can we overcome this pandemic — by sharing the vaccine fairly around the world. https://t.co/SVtXYdZsDC https://t.co/J9m8CW1Bso

Sunday is the International Day to #EndFistula, a serious childbirth injury caused by prolonged, obstructed labour without access to timely medical treatment. 

Learn more from @UNFPA: https://t.co/TftAuugxA9 https://t.co/8D7jv8Pwzb

"Equitable and sustainable vaccine roll-out worldwide is the quickest path towards a fast & fair recovery."

-- @antonioguterres stresses that #OnlyTogether will we overcome the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/Xx4BdSED4P https://t.co/SMZypezyQp

Obstetric fistula is a devastating, yet completely preventable childbirth injury affecting hundreds of thousands of women & girls every year.

Learn more on Sunday's International Day to #EndFistula. https://t.co/90XXo144AM via @UNFPA https://t.co/VQYqxiHdz2

Reduced speed limits are:

🚸 Safe
💪 Healthy
🌍 Green
🚶 Liveable

This Global Road Safety week, the #StreetsForLife campaign is calling for 30 km/h (20 mph) speed limits where people walk, live & play: https://t.co/F13XsGWqza https://t.co/hbiPc0lcuM

Despite progress in key areas such as clean water & energy, sanitation, forest management & waste, countries are on course to miss the environmental dimensions of the #GlobalGoals if we don't take urgent #ClimateAction.

More from @UNEP & @UNBiodiversity: https://t.co/ltPlC1tWzg https://t.co/TQuMxbVX7u

Flashback to 2016, when UN Messengers of Peace Jane Goodall (@JaneGoodallInst) & @LeoDiCaprio marked #PeaceDay at UNHQ. 

This week, Dr. Goodall received the @TempletonPrize for her commitment to deepening humanity's compassion & responsibility for all forms of life. Congrats! https://t.co/YOUBl6dOyH

Saturday's #BiodiversityDay is a reminder that we all have a role to play in protecting the biodiversity we depend on. 

Let’s act #ForNature together. 🌍 https://t.co/wHns1EuDkL https://t.co/QIKj1Q9E3E

☑️ Speed
☑️ Flexibility
☑️ Coordination 
☑️ Ownership 

Four basic elements helped shape the UN's response to the second wave of Ebola in Guinea. 

Read how those experiences can help improve response efforts of the future. https://t.co/FYoazZsP0C via @UN_SDG https://t.co/pYZ68xTpVH

The #COVID19 pandemic has shown that #OnlyTogether can the world resolve our common challenges. 

We all can be part of the solution #ForNature and people.

More on Saturday's #BiodiversityDay: https://t.co/uUAIfoH16I https://t.co/3QSyDAfTug

"The #COVID19 crisis has shown that we are only as strong as our weakest link and will only achieve recovery in solidarity." -- @antonioguterres

Get inspired by examples of solidarity & compassion in our latest  @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/UnOl9KBO7Z

Human activity is driving biodiversity loss around the world — but we can all do something about it. 

On Saturday's #BiodiversityDay, see how you can be part of the solution #ForNature: https://t.co/uUAIfoH16I via @UNBiodiversity https://t.co/5trVAYWCZt

3/4 of all emerging infectious diseases originate in animals.

New group of experts will work to improve understanding of how diseases with the potential to trigger pandemics emerge & spread.

More from @UNEP: https://t.co/Fi9JGjS8if

How are you ... really?
Asking that simple question can help our friends & family open up about how they are feeling.

During this #MentalHealthMonth, here are some tips to look after your own mental health & to help others who may need some extra support. https://t.co/1k8sk5M0Jz https://t.co/aVKjsTyGBx

Culture builds bridges between people & countries. As a driving force for development, it is essential to achieving the #GlobalGoals.

More from @UNESCO on Friday's World Day for #CulturalDiversity for Dialogue & Development: https://t.co/l8tdDXtseZ https://t.co/rxR5OyUA0d

"Vaccinating quickly & thoroughly around the world, together with continued public health measures, are the only way to end the pandemic."

-- @antonioguterres stresses that #OnlyTogether can we defeat #COVID19. https://t.co/D60upPA1q8 https://t.co/AsClgs5WrB

🫖 Tea isn't just a healthy drink - it's culture, heritage & a source of livelihood for millions of people.

📽️ Watch to learn more about one of the 🌏's most popular drinks. https://t.co/6PiU3D2B5M via @FAO https://t.co/R1Advckg9N

For the last year, the Verified initiative has mobilized action to combat #COVID19 misinformation & promote facts. 

Thanks to everyone who has helped share life-saving advice! 
#OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic. https://t.co/xZZ1FJXp9y https://t.co/VEY2fduIjZ

Tea has many health benefits due to its anti-inflammatory & antioxidant properties. 

On Friday's #InternationalTeaDay, @FAO has more about one of the world's oldest beverages: https://t.co/6PiU3D2B5M https://t.co/sXGpoNHoxE

Culture can play a 🗝️ role in our lives & economies as we recover from #COVID19. 

On Friday's World Day for #CulturalDiversity for Dialogue & Development, world leaders will gather virtually to share ideas on how to further support the creative economy. https://t.co/jAF6r1m1iI https://t.co/gcbCi73wFH

Sudan: Achieving peace & stability will require a continued spirt of unity, partnership & collaboration, UN Security Council hears on Thursday, following international conference focused on the country's economic revitalization. https://t.co/A65lQLgLAT

Tea is central to many cultures, and it contributes to employment, exports earnings & food security. 

More on Friday's #InternationalTeaDay: https://t.co/E9mem94Sbp https://t.co/Bb73GWBwmV

.@antonioguterres welcomes ceasefire between Gaza & Israel. 

He underscores the UN's commitment to work with Israelis & Palestinians to return to meaningful negotiations to end the occupation & allow for the realization of a two-State solution. https://t.co/cJAcqMib42

Amid #COVID19, culture has provided a sense of comfort & connection for people around the world.

On Friday's World Day for #CulturalDiversity for Dialogue & Development, join @UNESCO in celebrating culture as a source of resilience & unity. https://t.co/l8tdDXtseZ https://t.co/mg5sS1T1w4

“If there is a hell on earth, it is the lives of children in Gaza today."

-- @antonioguterres tells #UNGA. https://t.co/latOFcaZJg https://t.co/TAIa4auxZl

On Thursday's #WorldBeeDay, the UN joined people around the world in celebrating bees and their invaluable contributions to safeguarding our biodiversity. 

More in our @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/9xWnPaDquv

"Only through renewing our commitment & redoubling our efforts towards a negotiated solution can we bring this cruel violence & hatred to a definitive end."

-- @antonioguterres says UN is committed to working with Israelis & Palestinians to achieve peace. https://t.co/oodtOAEm2M https://t.co/6FU1x0Pos6

Bees...
🍓 increase food production
🍯 give us honey & nutritious food
🌲 help maintain biodiversity

On Thursday's #WorldBeeDay, @FAO shares 6 ways we can 'bee' grateful to & protect our pollinators: https://t.co/mTl8OmzJno https://t.co/GjxGBj3EPM

"What worries us the most is that we lose all the amazing gains that have been made over the past number of years."

@UNICEF Representative in India @DrYasminAHaque joined @MelissaFleming on Awake At Night to talk about the devastating #COVID19 surge & its impact on children.
#TBT to 2018 and the 1st-ever #WorldBeeDay 🐝, when we shared the story of our own resident bee colony at UNHQ in New York. https://t.co/Ap7R2z5Mp8 https://t.co/GDhqJc1SUl

Misinformation during a crisis like #COVID19 can result in people being left uninformed, unprotected & vulnerable.

❌ Don't share rumours
✅ Choose content verified by reliable sources
https://t.co/71POIuWBTF

🎨 : @RBdandi https://t.co/zwzFTQOz58

Much of the food we eat depends on bees 🐝.
These guardians of biodiversity play a 🗝️ role in achieving the #GlobalGoals. 

Learn more from @FAO on Thursday's #WorldBeeDay: https://t.co/xKZjyFVuuD https://t.co/fBWTbpi22z

The world has made great progress in expanding protected and conserved areas since 2010. 

But 1/3 of Key Biodiversity Areas still lack any protection.

More from @UNEP: 
https://t.co/RJFrSDUWRP https://t.co/dgCSUcNMnP

Our very existence depends on bees & other pollinators 🐝🦋🐦.

On Thursday's #WorldBeeDay, let's celebrate the vital role they play in maintaining our food supply & contributing to biodiversity. https://t.co/0PJP2F7A01 via @FAO https://t.co/4AQcBJ0PyO

Recovery from the #COVID19 pandemic offers an opportunity to address the root causes of conflict, focus on prevention & work toward achieving the #GlobalGoals, @antonioguterres tells the Security Council. 
https://t.co/Xx4BdSn2dh

Violence in Gaza has killed at least 60 children, injured 440+ others, says @UNICEFChief, calling for the immediate cessation of hostilities.

@UNRWA launches flash appeal for $38 million to support humanitarian needs. https://t.co/oVrD4p5aHe

Syria: #COVID19 has added more pressure on an already-strained health care system.

Here's how @Refugees is supporting the pandemic response in the country. https://t.co/ASpyLZher3 https://t.co/Eq3t2qOtLX

UN peacekeepers are working around the world in innovative ways to share accurate & timely information to highlight the impact of their work & counter false information.

More about why protecting the truth is essential for @UNPeacekeeping: 
https://t.co/y5bZfOxZIg https://t.co/PkvRHuhS4H

Food systems support the health & livelihoods of billions of people around the world.

The #Small4All competition will showcase small-to-medium businesses leading the charge for more sustainable, inclusive & resilient food systems. https://t.co/MhqByVZ0zh https://t.co/MqQgvEVjJU

“Faced with the situation in the Sahel, the international community must be motivated by a shared responsibility to act - in a spirit of solidarity with the populations of the region.”

-- @UNPeacekeeping chief @Lacroix_UN tells UN Security Council. https://t.co/fcENtxzB0F

Mental health conditions are leading causes of illness & disability among adolescents - a situation made even worse by increased isolation & psychosocial distress due to #COVID19.

This #MentalHealthMonth, @WHO has more on supporting young people. https://t.co/f8oBhC9NSV

Nearly 1 million Rohingya have fled their homes in Myanmar.

Together with Bangladesh & other partners, the UN has launched a response plan to support 880,000+ Rohingya refugees & 472,000+ Bangladeshis in surrounding host communities in Cox’s Bazar.
https://t.co/3jlTiEsQhA

As the world tackles the social & economic impacts of #COVID19, the UN is supporting countries in their efforts to recover better.

More on why continued coordination will be key to achieving the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/KNfWTiRtXk https://t.co/I8Anah4OhC

From low self-esteem to depression, the consequences of online bullying can be devastating for young people, especially during #COVID19. 

This #MentalHealthMonth, @UNICEF helps shed light on the dangers of cyberbullying & how to prevent it.

https://t.co/jRf0zrM1BP

🍓 Fruits & 🥦 vegetables must be handled with care 🌾 from fields to 🛒supermarkets & eventually to our plates 🍽️ to ensure they remain nutritious & safe to eat.

More on the Year of Fruits & Vegetables from @FAO: https://t.co/ZkuL7ySznx 
#IYFV2021 https://t.co/j3LYtKQYXr

Speed limits save lives. 

This Global Road Safety Week, join us in calling for limiting speeds to 30 km/h (20 mph) where people live, work & play. 

Get involved to achieve #StreetsforLife: https://t.co/2orKdGZoBP https://t.co/aOM4hjaQKo

Countries are coming together at the @UNODC #CCPCJ30 to discuss how to ensure effective, fair & humane criminal justice systems worldwide, improve equal access to legal aid, implement prison reform & more. https://t.co/J4x2vVwqRG https://t.co/HndpkDcOxQ

#LGBTIQ+ children face bullying & violence in school just because of who they are.

On Int’l Day against Homophobia, Transphobia & Biphobia, join @UNESCO's call to counter discrimination & hate with the power of education.
https://t.co/Zn29PmX7W0 #IDAHOBIT
https://t.co/zKYsVnJzVP

As humanitarian needs increase in Gaza amid ongoing violence, @WFP is providing immediate assistance to 50,000+ people through electronic food vouchers. 

https://t.co/IZfRLdMGX1

Working 55+ hours per week increases health risks.

Latest study from @WHO & @ILO indicates that long working hours have resulted in more deaths from heart disease & stroke globally.

More on Monday's World Hypertension Day: https://t.co/hHeRuepJoJ https://t.co/PbDo4BgxFU

Young people are creating a fearless future where everyone - including #LGBTIQ+ youth - are safe, loved and empowered to thrive – regardless of who they are or whom they love. 

Together we can make this future a reality! https://t.co/6XDvW19IYL #IDAHOBIT https://t.co/ajFbTusPR1

The #COVID19 crisis has highlighted the critical role of information & communication technologies, while also exposing the stark digital divide between & within countries. 

Monday is World Telecommunication & Information Society Day. https://t.co/SUmSwuf9mv #WTISD

For many #LGBTIQ+ people, leaving their hometown is the only way to truly be themselves. 

On the Int'l Day against Homophobia, Transphobia & Biphobia, see how YOU can help create a future where everyone belongs – no matter whom they love: https://t.co/NW5RtntOpL #IDAHOBIT https://t.co/gP0JlBGejQ

"In the face of #COVID19, businesses, governments & the digital community have proven resilient and innovative, helping to protect lives and livelihoods."

-- @antonioguterres on Monday's World Telecommunication & Information Society Day. https://t.co/PL4lIUN2y5 #WTISD https://t.co/VLXDoEqMSq

Human rights are for everyone – no matter who you are or whom you love.
❤️🧡💛💚💙💜

#StandUp4HumanRights on Monday's International Day against Homophobia, Transphobia & Biphobia and every day. https://t.co/Ljui9GqDYQ #IDAHOBIT via

#COVID19 exposed the indispensable role of communication technologies & the challenges posed by the digital divide.

On Monday's World Telecommunication & Information Society Day, @ITU explores how these tools can now help the world recover better. https://t.co/HcecDD1P7e #WTISD https://t.co/orZE7pLRQn

The streets of NYC were lit up on Wednesday night with projections of images created by artists, showing what they'll do once the pandemic is over.

#OnlyTogether can we end this crisis - by ensuring that people everywhere get access to #COVID19 vaccines. https://t.co/SVtXYdZsDC https://t.co/stMnHtmqrf

@UNICEF Representative in India @DrYasminAHaque joined @MelissaFleming on Awake At Night to talk about the devastating #COVID19 surge & its impact.
